alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 27 at 5:52PM CDT until April 27 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT/615 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHERN YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO AND WESTERN CHEYENNE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 452 PM MDT/552 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Wray to 14 miles north of Bonny Reservoir, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bonny Reservoir and St. Francis. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 207 and 210, and between mile markers 212 and 244. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These thunderstorms will produce damaging winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility.
